description._content: view large BrooklyNites Wednesday, May 16th 5–9 p.m. Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Pavilion, 1st floor BrooklyNites is a new weekday night program, held on the 3rd Wednesday of every month, featuring live jazz performances and gallery talks at the Brooklyn Museum. In conjunction with the opening of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art and its inaugural exhibitions, Global Feminisms and Pharaohs, Queens, and Goddesses, the month of May highlights female jazz vocalists. Malika Zarra headlines the event. Performances 5 p.m.: Abigail Riccards Group Brooklyn-based artist Abigail Riccards thrills with vocals that earned her a semifinalist spot in the prestigious Thelonious Monk International Jazz Vocal Competition. 6:30–8:30 p.m.: Malika Zarra, with Francis Jacob, Brahim Fribgane, and Mamadou Ba A Moroccan-French singer with a velvety, sinuous mezzo-soprano voice, Malika Zarra mixes rhythms from chaabi, Berber, Gnawa music, and jazz. Gallery Talks 6 p.m.: Pharaohs, Queens, and Goddesses 7:30 p.m.: Global Feminisms Tickets are $10 ($5 for Museum Members). Cash bar 5–9 p.m. Happy hour 5–6 p.m. Parking is a flat rate of $4 beginning at 5 p.m. All programs are subject to change. www.brooklynmuseum.org/visit/brooklynites.php
